sections.heading: Definitions. As used in this act:(1)“Act” means the Florida Revised Uniform Limited Partnership Act of 2005, as amended
sections.text: (2)“Certificate of limited partnership” means the certificate required by s. 620.1201. The term includes the certificate as amended or restated.(3)“Contribution,” except in the phrase “right of

sections.heading: Powers. A limited partnership has the powers to do all things necessary or convenient to carry on its activities, including the power to sue, be sued, and defend in its own name and to maintain an action against a partner for harm caused to the limited partnership by a breach of the partnership agreement or
sections.text: A limited partnership has the powers to do all things necessary or convenient to carry on its activities, including the power to sue, be sued, and defend in its own name and to maintain an action against a partner for harm caused to the limited partnership by a breach of the partnership agreement or violation of a duty to the partnership.History.—s. 17, ch. 2005-267.

sections.heading: Name. (1)The name of a limited partnership may contain the name of any partner
sections.text: (2)The name of a limited partnership that is not a limited liability limited partnership must contain the phrase “limited partnership” or “limited” or the abbreviation “L.P.” or “Ltd.” or the designation “LP,” and may not conta

sections.heading: Pleading. In a derivative action, the complaint must state with particularity:(1)The date and content of plaintiff’s demand and the general partners’ response to the demand; or(2)Why demand should be excused as futile

sections.heading: Name. The name of a limited liability partnership must end with “Registered Limited Liability Partnership,” “Limited Liability Partnership,” “R
Applicability. Effective January 1, 1998, the Revised Uniform Partnership Act of 1995 governs all partnerships
